turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Arlo.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. ANDY'S ICE CREAM FACTORY/ANDY'S OFFICE - DAY.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. TUNNEL/AIR VENT - DAY.

turns.speaker: MASON
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: BLACK BACKGROUND.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: We've gotta take out Brynner's van before  they reach...

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. GOMEZ'S HELICOPTER - DAY.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Do it now.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. GOMEZ'S HELICOPTER - DAY.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Uh, so head for the other end of the tunnel.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. VITELLI'S HELICOPTER - DAY.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: I'll stay here and secure this position.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. POSTAL VAN - DAY.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: It's too late, Mason. I've...

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. TUNNEL - DAY.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: ...gotta seal it.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. GOMEZ'S HELICOPTER - DAY.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Negative.  Negative.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. VITELLI'S HELICOPTER - DAY.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: There's ammo fire from Brynner's vehicle.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: He must've had a damn arsenal in there.

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. TUNNEL - DAY.

turns.speaker: VITELLI
turns.text: Now!  Seal that tunnel now!

turns.speaker: SCENE
turns.text: INT. TUNNEL - DAY.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Look at that.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Heat's murder.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Barney, who is this bimbo? He a regular customer?

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Take it easy, Jake.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Look, pal. I make an honest living. People don't come to me unless they're miserable and I help 'em out of a bad situation. I don't kick them out of their homes like you jerks who work in the bank.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: Jake, for Christ's sake.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I don't know how that got in the paper as a matter of fact  it surprised me it was so quick. I make an honest living.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: 'Course you do, Jake.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: An honest living.

turns.speaker: BARNEY
turns.text: So anyway, he says, 'whyn't you do what the Chinese do?'

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'll settle for L.A. County.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Row twenty-three, section C.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How come all these new names are pasted into the plat book?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Land sales out of escrow are always recorded within the week.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Then these are all new owners?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: But that means that most of the valley's been sold in the last few months.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: If that's what it says.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Can I check one of these volumes out?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Sir, this is not a lending library, it's the Hall of Records.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, then, how about a ruler?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: A ruler?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: The print's pretty fine. I forgot my glasses. I'd like to be able to read across.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: I said horseshit.  Horseshit.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yes, sir, that's what it looks like. I'll give you that.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Always?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: What?  Oh, damn near yes. Unless the animal's sick or something.  And the steam rising off it like that in the morning. That's life, Mr. Gittes. Life.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: You know, you've got a nasty reputation, Mr. Gittes. I like that.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: If you were a bank president that would be one thing, but in your business it's admirable. And it's good advertising.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: It doesn't hurt.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: It's why you attract a client like my daughter.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Probably.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: But I'm surprised you're still working for her, unless she's suddenly come up with another husband.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No. She happens to think the last one was murdered.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: How did she get that idea?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I think I gave it to her.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Fine, as long as you don't serve chicken that way.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Tell me. What do the police say?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: They're calling it an accident.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Who's the investigating officer?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Lou Escobar  he's a Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Do you know him?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Oh yes.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Where from?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: We worked in Chinatown together.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Would you call him a capable man?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Very.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Honest?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Far as it goes. Of course he has to swim in the same water we all do.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Of course, but you've got no reason to think he's bungled the case?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: None.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: That's too bad.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Too bad?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: It disturbs me, Mr. Gittes. It makes me think you're taking my daughter for a ride. Financially speaking, of course. How much are you charging her?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: My usual fee, plus a bonus if I come up with any results.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Are you sleeping with her? Come, come, Mr. Gittes. You don't have to think about that to remember, do you?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: If you want an answer to that question I can always put one of my men on the job. Good afternoon, Mr. Cross.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Mr. Gittes!  You're dealing with a disturbed woman who's lost her husband. I don't want her taken advantage of. Sit down.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: You may think you know what you're dealing with, but believe me, you don't.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Why is that funny?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: It's what the D.A. used to tell me about Chinatown.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Was he right?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: ...Exactly what do you know about me, Mr. Gittes?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mainly that you're rich and too respectable to want your name in the papers.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: 'Course I'm respectable. I'm old. Politicians, ugly buildings and whores all get respectable if they last long enough. I'll double whatever your fees are and I'll pay you ten thousand dollars if you can find Hollis' girlfriend.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: His girlfriend?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Yes, his girlfriend.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You mean the little chippie he was with at the El Macando?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Yes. She's disappeared, hasn't she?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Doesn't that strike you as odd?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No. She's probably scared to death.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Wouldn't it be useful to talk to her?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: If Mulwray was murdered, she was probably one of the last people to see him.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You didn't see Mulwray much, did you?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: When was the last time?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Sheriff's gold posse... bunch of damn fools who pay $5,000 apiece to the sheriff's reelection. I let 'em practice up out here.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah. Do you remember the last time you talked to Mulwray?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: At my age, you tend to lose track...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, It was about five days ago. You were outside the Pig 'n Whistle and you had one hell of an argument.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I've got the photographs in my office. If they'll help you remember. What was the argument about?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: My daughter.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What about her?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Just find the girl, Mr. Gittes. I think she is frightened and I happen to know Hollis was fond of her. I'd like to help her if I can.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I didn't realize you and Hollis were so fond of each other.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Hollis Mulwray made this city and he made me a fortune... We were a lot closer than Evelyn realized.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: If you want to hire me, I still have to know what you and Mulwray were arguing about.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Well... she's an extremely jealous person. I didn't want her to find out about the girl.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How did you find out?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: I've still got a few teeth in my head, Mr. Gittes, and a few friends in town.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Okay. My secretary'll send you a letter of agreement. Tell me are you worried about that girl, or what Evelyn might do to her?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Just find the girl.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'll look into it as soon as I check out some avocado groves.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Avocado groves?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: We'll be in touch, Mr. Cross.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Well, you don't look any the worse for wear, Mr. Gittes, I must say... where's the girl?...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I've got her.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Is she all right?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: She's fine.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: With her mother.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'd like you to look at something, Mr. Cross.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: An obituary column... can you read in this light?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Yes... I think I can manage...

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: What does this mean?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That you killed Hollis Mulwray.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: ...the coroner's report showed Mulwray had salt water in his lungs.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Hollie was always fond of tide-pools. You know what he used to say about them?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Haven't the faintest idea.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: That's where life begins... marshes, sloughs, tide-pools... he was fascinated by them...  you know when we first came out here he figured that if you dumped water onto desert sand it would percolate down into the bedrock and stay there, instead of evaporating the way it does in most reservoirs. You'd lose only twenty percent instead of seventy or eighty. He made this city.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: And that's what you were going to do in the Valley?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: No, Mr. Gittes. That's what I am doing with the Valley. The bond issue passes Tuesday. There'll be ten million to build an aqueduct and reservoir. I'm doing it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: There's going to be some irate citizens when they find out they're paying for water they're not getting.

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: That's all taken care of. You see, Mr. Gittes. Either you bring the water to L.A. or you bring L.A. to the water.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How do you do that?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Just incorporate the Valley into the city so the water goes to L.A. after all. It's very simple.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How much are you worth?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: I have no idea. How much do you want?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I want to know what you're worth. Over ten million?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: Oh, my, yes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Then why are you doing it? How much better can you eat? What can you buy that you can't already afford?

turns.speaker: CROSS
turns.text: The future, Mr. Gittes. The future. Now where's the girl?... I want the only daughter I have left... as you found out, Evelyn was lost to me a long time ago.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Who do you blame for that? Her?

turns.speaker: CROSS' VOICE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Have you got your checkbook handy, Mr. Cross? I've got the girl.

turns.speaker: CROSS' VOICE
turns.text: You've got her? Where?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Do you remember the figures we discussed?

turns.speaker: CROSS' VOICE
turns.text: Of course I do. Where are you?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: At your daughter's house. How soon can you get here?

turns.speaker: CROSS' VOICE
turns.text: Two hours... tell me, will Evelyn be there as well?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Either that or she'll be in jail.

turns.speaker: CROSS' VOICE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Just bring your checkbook.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: She's just no good.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What can I tell you, Kid? You're right. When you're right, you're right, and you're right.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Ain't worth thinking about.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You're absolutely right, I wouldn't give her another thought.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: You know, you're okay, Mr. Gittes. I know it's your job, but you're okay.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Thanks, Curly. Call me Jake.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Thanks. You know something, Jake?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What's that, Curly?

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: I think I'll kill her.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: They don't kill a guy for that.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Oh they don't?

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Not for your wife. That's the unwritten law.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You bet your ass you don't. You can't even pay me off.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: I'll pay the rest next trip. We only caught sixty ton of skipjack around San Benedict. We hit a chubasco, they don't pay you for skipjack the way they do for tuna or albacore.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Forget it. I only mention it to illustrate a point...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What kind of guy do you think I am?

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Thanks, Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Call me Jake. Careful driving home, Curly.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Gee, this is a surprise, Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Call me Jake. How is everything?

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Just sitting down to supper, Jake. Care to join us?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: How about a glass of wine? Honey, this is...

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Sure thing.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Curly, where's your car?

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: In the garage.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Where's that?

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Off the alley.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Could you drive me somewhere?

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Sure, as soon as we eat.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Right now, Curly. It can't wait.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: I'll just tell my wife.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Tell her later.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How much do you owe me, Curly?

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Oh, gee, Mr. Gittes we're going out tomorrow. I know you been real good about it but my cousin Auggie's sick.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Forget it. How would you like to pay me off by taking a couple of passengers to Ensenada... you'd have to leave tonight.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I might be able to squeeze an extra seventy-five bucks out of it for you. Maybe an even hundred.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Plus what I owe you?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'll throw that in too.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: Okay, you got yourself a boat.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Tell Mrs. Mulwray to wait for half an hour after you get there. Then if I don't show, take her down to the boat.

turns.speaker: CURLY
turns.text: You sure this is okay?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Curly, you know how long I been in business.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: So there's this fella who's tired of screwing his wife.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Jake, listen.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Shut up, Duffy, you're always in a hurry and his friend says why not do what the Chinese do? So he says what do they do? His friend says the Chinese they screw for a while. Just listen a second, Duffy...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: There's seven ashtrays in this room, Duffy.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That's a filthy habit.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: I said okay, Jake.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah, yeah. If she'd come in here saying she was Shirley Temple you'd say okay to that, too.

turns.speaker: DUFFY
turns.text: Then what'll you do?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Sue the shit out of 'em.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I've been wanting to meet you.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Did you know that you're a very wealthy woman?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: I'm not.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well you own a lot of land.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Not anymore. Oh, some time ago, my late husband owned a good deal of beach property in Long Beach, but we lost it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: That's just lovely.

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Thank you...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Where did you get this material?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: The apple core club.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: The apple core?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: No. The albacore. It's a fish. My grandson's a member and they take very nice care of us.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How do they do that?

turns.speaker: EMMA
turns.text: Give us things. Not just some old flag like this, but -

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: But what?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Hello, Jake.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How are you, Lou?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: I have a cold I can't seem to shake but other than that, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Summer colds are the worst.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Yeah, they are.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Thanks, Lou.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: How'd you get past the guards?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, to tell you the truth, I lied a little.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: You've done well by yourself.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I get by.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Well, sometimes it takes a while for a man to find himself and I guess you have.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: You're behind the times, Jake. They've got steam irons now.  And I'm out of Chinatown.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Since when?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Since I made Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Congratulations.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Uh-huh. So what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Looking for someone.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Hollis Mulwray. You seen him?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Oh yes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'd like to talk to him.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: You're welcome to try. There he is.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: You wouldn't happen to know the present whereabouts of the young woman.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Or her name?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: I don't want it anymore.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: No. It was an accident.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You mean that's what you're going to call it.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: No, he drowned a cousin of mine with about five hundred other people. But they weren't very important, just a bunch of dumb Mexicans living by a dam. Now beat it, Gittes, you don't come out of this smelling like a rose, you know.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Oh yeah? Can you think of something to charge me with?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: When I do, you'll hear about it.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Didn't you call?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: How do you happen to know her?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I don't.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Let me show you something.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Isn't that your number?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Is it? I forget. I don't call myself that often.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Just to be on the safe side, we had Loach here give you a ring.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah, I took 'em. So what?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: How did she...  ...happen to have them?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: You really think I'm stupid, don't you, Gittes?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I don't think about it one way or the other. But if you want, give me a day or two, and I'll get back to you. Now I'd like to go home.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: I want the rest of the pictures.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What pictures?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: This broad hired you, Gittes, not Evelyn Mulwray.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Yeah. Somebody wanted to shake down Mulwray, she hired you, and that's how you happen to know Mulwray was murdered.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I heard it was an accident.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: C'mon, you think you're dealing with a bunch of assholes? Mulwray had salt water in his goddam lungs! Now how did he get that... in a fresh water reservoir?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: You were following him night and day. You saw who killed him. You even took pictures of it. It was Evelyn Mulwray. She's been paying you off like a slot machine ever since her husband died.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You accusing me of extortion?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I don't think I need a day or two. You're even dumber than you think I think you are. Not only that, I'd never extort a nickel out of my worst enemy, that's where I draw the line, Escobar.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Yeah, I once knew a whore who for enough money would piss in a customer's face, but she'd never shit on his chest. That's where she drew the line.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, I hope she wasn't too much of a disappointment to you, Lou.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: I want those photographs, Gittes. We're talking about accessory after the fact, conspiracy, and extortion. Minimum.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Why do you think Mulwray's body was moved you dimwit? Evelyn Mulwray knocked off her husband in the ocean and thought it would look like more of an accident if she hauled him up to the Oak Pass Reservoir?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mulwray was murdered and moved because somebody didn't want his body found in the ocean.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: And why's that?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: He found out somebody was dumping water there. That's what they were trying to cover up by moving him.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: C'mon I'll show you.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: It's too late.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Too late for what?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: They only dump the water at night.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I know what he says.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Shut up.  Go on.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: I don't suppose you got any idea Where she went?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Matter of fact I do.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Her maid's house. I think she knows something's up.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: What's the maid's address?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: She lives in Pedro. I'll write it down for you.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: No, Gittes, you'll show us.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: If she's not there, you're going downtown, and you're staying there til she shows up.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Gee, Lou, I'm doing the best I can.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Tell us about it on the way to Pedro.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: That's it?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Well, let's go.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Do me a favor, will you, Lou?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: You never learn, do you, Gittes?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I guess not.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Give you three minutes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Gee, thanks, Lou.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Mrs. Mulwray, you don't want to run around like that.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Oh, Christ. Escobar, you don't know what's going on. Let her go. I'll explain it later.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Mrs. Mulwray, it's a very serious offense pointing that at an officer of the law. It's a felony.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Let her go. She didn't kill anybody.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mrs. Mulwray.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Lou, she will kill you. Let her go for now. You don't know.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Gittes, stay outta this.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Who is he, get his name? I'll kill him.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Take it easy, take it easy, it was an accident.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: An accident?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Get him away from her. He's responsible for everything. Get him away from her!

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Jake, you're very disturbed. You're crazy. That's her father.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: It looks like he was washed the entire length of the runoff channel. Could he swim?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Obviously the fall must have knocked him out.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: ...Well, it didn't make him happy...

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: But there is no possibility he would have taken his own life?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Mrs. Mulwray, do you happen to know the name of the young woman in question?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Do you know where she might be?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Certainly not!

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: You and your husband never discussed her?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: He... we did... he wouldn't tell me her name.  We quarreled over her... of course. It came as a complete surprise to me.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: A complete surprise?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: But I thought you'd hired a private investigator.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: A private investigator?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Well yes.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Will you need me for anything else, Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: ESCOBAR
turns.text: I don't think so, Mrs. Mulwray. Of course you have my deepest sympathy and if we need anymore information, we'll be in touch.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Not that Mulwray?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes, that Mulwray, Mr. Gittes. And since you agree with me we've never met, you must also agree that I haven't hired you to do anything. Certainly not spy on my husband. I see you like publicity, Mr. Gittes. Well, you're going to get it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Now wait a minute, Mrs. Mulwray...

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Would you like something to drink?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What are you having?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Iced tea.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Yeah. Fine, thank you.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: My husband's at the office.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Actually he's not. And he's moved from his apartment at the El Macando.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: That's not his apartment.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Anyway... I... the point is, Mrs. Mulwray.  I'm not in business to be loved, but I am in business, and believe me, whoever set up your husband, set me up. L.A.'s a small town, people talk.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'm just trying to make a living, and I don't want to become a local Joke.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Mr. Gittes, you've talked me into it. I'll drop the lawsuit.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I said I'll drop it.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: So let's just drop the whole thing. Sugar?  Lemon?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mrs. Mulwray?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes, Mr. Gittes?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I don't want to drop it.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I should talk this over with your husband.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Why?... What on earth for?  Look, Hollis seems to think you're an innocent man.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, I've been accused of many things, Mrs. Mulwray, but never that.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You see, somebody went to a lot of trouble here, and I want to find out, lawsuit or no lawsuit. I'm not the one who's supposed to be caught with my pants down... so I'd like to see your husband. Unless that's a problem.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: May I speak frankly, Mrs. Mulwray?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: You may if you can, Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Well, that little girlfriend, she was attractive in a cheap sort of way of course.  She's disappeared. Maybe they disappeared together somewhere.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Suppose they did. How does it concern you?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Nothing personal, Mrs. Mulwray, I just --

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It's very personal. It couldn't be more personal. Is this a business or an obsession with you?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Look at it this way. Now this phony broad, excuse the language, says she's you, she's hired me. Whoever put her up to it, didn't have anything against me. They were out to get your husband. Now if I see him, I can help him.  Did you talk this morning?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No. I went riding rather early.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Looks like you went quite a distance.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: No, Just riding bareback, that's all. Anyway, you might try the Oak Pass or Stone Canyon Reservoirs. Sometimes at lunch Hollis takes walks around them. Otherwise he'll be home by 6:30.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I'll stop by.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Please call first.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mrs. Mulwray?... Mrs. Mulwray.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: ...Just a minute...

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You left your keys in the ignition.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Oh... thank you.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Thank you for going along with me. I just didn't want to explain anything... I'll send you a check.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: A check?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I got your check in the mall.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Yes. As I said, I was very grateful.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Mrs. Mulwray, I'm afraid that's not good enough.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Well, how much would you like?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Stop it. The money's fine. It's generous but you've shortchanged me on the story.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I have?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: I think so. Something besides your husband's death was bothering you. You were upset but not that upset.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Mr. Gittes...  Don't tell me how I feel.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Sorry. Look, you sue me, your husband dies, you drop the lawsuit like a hot potato, and all of it quicker than wind from a duck's ass. Excuse me. Then you ask me to lie to the police.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: It wasn't much of a lie.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: If your husband was killed it was.  This can look like you paid me off to withhold evidence.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: But he wasn't killed.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Well, I suppose I am... actually I knew about the affair.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: How did you find out?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: My husband.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: He told you?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: And you weren't the slightest bit upset about it?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I was grateful.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You'll have to explain that, Mrs. Mulwray.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Look, I do matrimonial work, It's my metiay.  When a wife tells me she's happy her husband is cheating on her it runs contrary to my experience.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Unless what?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: She's cheating on him.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I don't like the word 'cheat.'

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Did you have affairs?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Mr. Gittes.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Did he know?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Well I wouldn't run home and tell him whenever I went to bed with someone, if that's what you mean.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Is there anything else you want to know?

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: Where you were when your husband died.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I can't tell you.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You mean you don't know where you were?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I mean I can't tell you.

turns.speaker: GITTES
turns.text: You were seeing someone, too.
